panels.visual: Giovanni dashes into the melee, his dagger finding a cultist's heart before the man can raise his weapon. His priest's robes are spattered with blood, his face a mask of holy purpose. Beside him, Sadia's blade cleaves through a cultist's spear and then through the cultist himself. Behind them, one of the drummers begins to transform - fur sprouting from his skin, jaw distending into a muzzle.
panels.narration: Giovanni saw one of the drummers beginning to transform.

panels.visual: Karishkir's arm extends far beyond what any human limb should reach - elongating impossibly - and her clawed hand closes around Lüèduó's throat. She drags him toward her with inhuman strength. His scarves trail behind him as he struggles. Her other hand rakes at his face, leaving bloody gashes across his cheek. Her smile never wavers.
panels.narration: Her arm shot out - extending far beyond what any human limb should reach.

panels.visual: Isaac stands near the entrance, his hands raised high, complex patterns of light weaving between his fingers. Pure, brilliant, painful light floods the chamber like the wrath of heaven itself - washing over the bone walls, the screaming cultists, the battling warriors. The cultists howl and writhe, covering their eyes. Nizack staggers, blinded. Even the heroes are caught in the brilliance. The contrast of holy light against the cathedral of death is absolute.
panels.narration: Light began to pour from his upraised hands - pure, brilliant, painful light that flooded the chamber like the wrath of heaven itself.
